51 template <typename T, typename Derived>
52 class optional_holder_base
53 {
54 public:
62  bool operator==(const optional_holder_base& other) const
63  {
64  if (this == &other)
65  return true;
66 
67  if (getDerived()->hasValue() != other.getDerived()->hasValue())
68  return false;
69 
70  if (getDerived()->hasValue())
71  return get() == other.get();
72 
73  return true;
74  }
75 
81  explicit operator bool() const noexcept
82  {
83  return getDerived()->hasValue();
84  }
85 
93  const T* operator->() const
94  {
95  return std::addressof(get());
96  }
97 
105  T* operator->()
106  {
107  return std::addressof(get());
108  }
109 
117  const T& value() const
118  {
119  return get();
120  }
121 
129  T& value()
130  {
131  return get();
132  }
133 
134 protected:
135  void checkHasValue() const
136  {
137  if (!getDerived()->hasValue())
138  throw CppRuntimeException("Trying to access value of non-present optional field!");
139  }
140 
141 private:
142  T& get()
143  {
144  return getDerived()->operator*();
145  }
146 
147  const T& get() const
148  {
149  return getDerived()->operator*();
150  }
151 
152  Derived* getDerived()
153  {
154  return static_cast<Derived*>(this);
155  }
156 
157  const Derived* getDerived() const
158  {
159  return static_cast<const Derived*>(this);
160  }
161 };
162 
166 template <typename T, typename ALLOC>
167 class heap_optional_holder : public optional_holder_base<T, heap_optional_holder<T, ALLOC>>
168 {
169 public:
170  using allocator_type = ALLOC;
171  using allocator_traits = std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>;
172  using storage_type = zserio::unique_ptr<T, allocator_type>;
173 
179  allocator_type get_allocator() const
180  {
181  return m_storage.get_deleter().get_allocator();
182  }
183 
189  explicit constexpr heap_optional_holder(const allocator_type& allocator = allocator_type()) noexcept :
190  m_storage(nullptr, allocator)
191  {}
192 
198  constexpr heap_optional_holder(NullOptType, const allocator_type& allocator = allocator_type()) noexcept :
199  m_storage(nullptr, allocator)
200  {}
201 
208  heap_optional_holder(const T& value, const allocator_type& allocator = allocator_type()) :
209  m_storage(zserio::allocate_unique<T, allocator_type>(allocator, value))
210  {}
211 
218  heap_optional_holder(T&& value, const allocator_type& allocator = allocator_type()) :
219  m_storage(zserio::allocate_unique<T, allocator_type>(allocator, std::move(value)))
220  {}
221 
228  template <typename ...U>
229  heap_optional_holder(const allocator_type& allocator, U&& ...u) :
230  m_storage(zserio::allocate_unique<T, allocator_type>(allocator, std::forward<U>(u)...))
231  {}
232 
238  heap_optional_holder(const heap_optional_holder& other) :
239  m_storage(copy_initialize(other,
240  allocator_traits::select_on_container_copy_construction(other.m_storage.get_deleter().get_allocator())))
241  {}
242 
249  heap_optional_holder(const heap_optional_holder& other, const allocator_type& allocator) :
250  m_storage(copy_initialize(other, allocator))
251  {}
252 
258  heap_optional_holder(heap_optional_holder&& other) noexcept = default;
259 
266  heap_optional_holder(heap_optional_holder&& other, const allocator_type& allocator) :
267  m_storage(move_initialize(std::move(other), allocator))
268  {
269  other.reset();
270  }
271 
279  heap_optional_holder& operator=(const heap_optional_holder& other)
280  {
281  if (this == &other)
282  return *this;
283 
284  m_storage = copy_initialize(other,
285  allocator_traits::propagate_on_container_copy_assignment::value ?
286  other.m_storage.get_deleter().get_allocator() :
287  m_storage.get_deleter().get_allocator());
288 
289  return *this;
290  }
291 
299  heap_optional_holder& operator=(heap_optional_holder&& other)
300  {
301  if (this == &other)
302  return *this;
303 
304  m_storage = move_initialize(std::move(other),
305  allocator_traits::propagate_on_container_move_assignment::value ?
306  other.m_storage.get_deleter().get_allocator() :
307  m_storage.get_deleter().get_allocator());
308  other.reset();
309 
310  return *this;
311  }
312 
320  heap_optional_holder& operator=(const T& value)
321  {
322  set(value);
323 
324  return *this;
325  }
326 
334  heap_optional_holder& operator=(T&& value)
335  {
336  set(std::move(value));
337 
338  return *this;
339  }
340 
344  void reset() noexcept
345  {
346  m_storage.reset();
347  }
348 
354  bool hasValue() const noexcept
355  {
356  return bool(m_storage);
357  }
358 
366  const T& operator*() const
367  {
368  this->checkHasValue();
369  return *m_storage.get();
370  }
371 
379  T& operator*()
380  {
381  this->checkHasValue();
382  return *m_storage.get();
383  }
384 
385 private:
386  template <typename U = T>
387  void set(U&& value)
388  {
389  reset();
390  m_storage = zserio::allocate_unique<T, allocator_type>(
391  m_storage.get_deleter().get_allocator(), std::forward<U>(value));
392  }
393 
394  static storage_type copy_initialize(const heap_optional_holder& other, const allocator_type& allocator)
395  {
396  return other.hasValue() ?
397  zserio::allocate_unique<T, allocator_type>(allocator, *other) :
398  storage_type(nullptr, allocator);
399  }
400 
401  static storage_type move_initialize(heap_optional_holder&& other, const allocator_type& allocator)
402  {
403  if (other.hasValue())
404  {
405  return allocator == other.m_storage.get_deleter().get_allocator() ?
406  std::move(other.m_storage) :
407  zserio::allocate_unique<T, allocator_type>(allocator, std::move(*other));
408  }
409  else
410  return storage_type(nullptr, allocator);
411  }
412 
413  storage_type m_storage;
414 };
415 
416 
420 template <typename T>
421 class in_place_storage
422 {
423 public:
427  in_place_storage() {}
428 
432  ~in_place_storage() = default;
433 
436  in_place_storage(const in_place_storage&) = delete;
437  in_place_storage& operator=(const in_place_storage&) = delete;
445  in_place_storage(in_place_storage&& other) noexcept(std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<T>::value)
446  {
447  move(std::move(other));
448  }
449 
457  in_place_storage& operator=(in_place_storage&& other)
458  {
459  move(std::move(other));
460 
461  return *this;
462  }
463 
469  void* getStorage()
470  {
471  return &m_inPlace;
472  }
473 
479  T* getObject()
480  {
481  return reinterpret_cast<T*>(&m_inPlace);
482  }
483 
489  const T* getObject() const
490  {
491  return reinterpret_cast<const T*>(&m_inPlace);
492  }
493 
494 private:
495  void move(in_place_storage&& other)
496  {
497  new (&m_inPlace) T(std::move(*other.getObject()));
498  other.getObject()->~T(); // ensure that destructor of object in original storage is called
499  }
500 
501  // Caution!
502  // We use static constants as a WORKAROUND for a GCC 8/9 bug observed when cross-compiling with -m32 flag.
503  // The compilers somehow spoils the aligned storage when alignof(T) is used directly as the template
504  // argument which leads to "*** stack smashing detected ***" error (as observed in some langauge tests).
505  static constexpr size_t SIZEOF_T = sizeof(T);
506  static constexpr size_t ALIGNOF_T = alignof(T);
507  typedef typename std::aligned_storage<SIZEOF_T, ALIGNOF_T>::type AlignedStorage;
508  AlignedStorage m_inPlace;
509 };
510 
514 template <typename T>
515 class inplace_optional_holder : public optional_holder_base<T, inplace_optional_holder<T>>
516 {
517 public:
521  constexpr inplace_optional_holder() noexcept
522  {}
523 
527  constexpr inplace_optional_holder(NullOptType) noexcept
528  {}
529 
535  inplace_optional_holder(const T& value)
536  {
537  new (m_storage.getStorage()) T(value);
538  m_hasValue = true;
539  }
540 
546  inplace_optional_holder(T&& value)
547  {
548  new (m_storage.getStorage()) T(std::move(value));
549  m_hasValue = true;
550  }
551 
557  inplace_optional_holder(const inplace_optional_holder& other)
558  {
559  if (other.hasValue())
560  {
561  new (m_storage.getStorage()) T(*other.m_storage.getObject());
562  m_hasValue = true;
563  }
564  }
565 
571  inplace_optional_holder(inplace_optional_holder&& other)
572  noexcept(std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<in_place_storage<T>>::value)
573  {
574  if (other.hasValue())
575  {
576  m_storage = std::move(other.m_storage);
577  other.m_hasValue = false;
578  m_hasValue = true;
579  }
580  }
581 
587  template <typename ...U>
588  explicit inplace_optional_holder(InPlaceT, U&& ...u)
589  {
590  new (m_storage.getStorage()) T(std::forward<U>(u)...);
591  m_hasValue = true;
592  }
593 
597  ~inplace_optional_holder()
598  {
599  reset();
600  }
601 
609  inplace_optional_holder& operator=(const inplace_optional_holder& other)
610  {
611  if (this != &other)
612  {
613  reset();
614  if (other.hasValue())
615  {
616  new (m_storage.getStorage()) T(*other.m_storage.getObject());
617  m_hasValue = true;
618  }
619  }
620 
621  return *this;
622  }
623 
631  inplace_optional_holder& operator=(inplace_optional_holder&& other)
632  {
633  if (this != &other)
634  {
635  reset();
636  if (other.hasValue())
637  {
638  m_storage = std::move(other.m_storage);
639  other.m_hasValue = false;
640  m_hasValue = true;
641  }
642  }
643 
644  return *this;
645  }
646 
654  inplace_optional_holder& operator=(const T& value)
655  {
656  set(value);
657 
658  return *this;
659  }
660 
668  inplace_optional_holder& operator=(T&& value)
669  {
670  set(std::move(value));
671 
672  return *this;
673  }
674 
678  void reset() noexcept
679  {
680  if (hasValue())
681  {
682  m_storage.getObject()->~T();
683  m_hasValue = false;
684  }
685  }
686 
692  bool hasValue() const noexcept
693  {
694  return m_hasValue;
695  }
696 
704  const T& operator*() const
705  {
706  this->checkHasValue();
707  return *m_storage.getObject();
708  }
709 
717  T& operator*()
718  {
719  this->checkHasValue();
720  return *m_storage.getObject();
721  }
722 
723 private:
724  template <typename U = T>
725  void set(U&& value)
726  {
727  reset();
728  new (m_storage.getStorage()) T(std::forward<U>(value));
729  m_hasValue = true;
730  }
731 
732  in_place_storage<T> m_storage;
733  bool m_hasValue = false;
734 };
735 
736 } // namespace detail

738 // Be aware that if Inplace/HeapOptionalHolder is defined by typename, C++ compiler will have problem with
739 // template function overload, see HashCodeUtil.h (overloads for objects and for Inplace/HeapOptionalHolder).
743 template <typename T>
744 using InplaceOptionalHolder = detail::inplace_optional_holder<T>;
745 
749 template <typename T, typename ALLOC = std::allocator<T>>
750 using HeapOptionalHolder = detail::heap_optional_holder<T, ALLOC>;
